THIS PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP AN ACCELERATOR PLAN ADDRESSING AT LEAST THREE SDOH PRIORITY AREAS WITH ADDITIONAL PRIORITY AREAS RECOMMENDED BY HEALTH EQUITY ACTION LEADERS (HEAL) BOARD. OUR FOCUSED PRIORITY AREAS WILL BE SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS, FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY, AND THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT. THE HEAL BOARD WILL BE MADE UP OF TWELVE HISPANIC COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO HAVE EXPERIENCE WITH INEQUITIES RELATED TO HEALTHY FOOD AND ACTIVE LIVING ACCESS, AS WELL AS FEELINGS OF MISTRUST. THE HEAL BOARD MEMBERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN A POWER-BUILDING PROCESS TO MAP THE CONDITIONS THAT DRIVE MISTRUST AND POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES WHERE HISPANICS LIVE, LEARN, WORK, AND PLAY. THE HEAL BOARD AND IDENTIFIED PROJECT LEADERSHIP TEAM WILL COLLECTIVELY DEVELOP AN ACCELERATOR PLAN THAT WILL PRIORITIZE THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE HEAL BOARD MAKING THIS PLAN COMMUNITY-DRIVEN, THUS INCREASING THE MULTISECTORAL COLLABORATION NEEDED TO IMPLEMENT THESE STRATEGIES.  SCDHEC’S UPSTATE PUBLIC HEALTH REGION, CHARGED WITH PROMOTING AND PROTECTING THE PUBLIC'S HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT IN SOUTH CAROLINA, WILL SERVE AS THE PROJECT LEAD AND PROVIDE OVERSIGHT FOR PLAN DEVELOPMENT. THE PROJECT’S COMMUNITY PARTNER, LIVEWELL GREENVILLE, WILL FACILITATE THE HEAL BOARD POWER-BUILDING PROCESS AND PROVIDE LEADERSHIP TEAM COORDINATION. THE PROJECT’S EVALUATION PARTNER, FURMAN UNIVERSITY’S INSTITUTE FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF COMMUNITY HEALTH, WILL OFFER AN EVALUATION OF THE HEAL BOARD PROCESS AND RESEARCH COMMUNITY STRATEGIES FOR IMPLEMENTATION IN OUR GREENVILLE COUNTY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN. THIS PROJECT’S GOALS ARE TO 1) INCREASE COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS, 2) DEVELOP AN IMPLEMENTATION-READY ACCELERATOR PLAN FOR GREENVILLE COUNTY, AND 3) MITIGATE FUTURE DISPARITIES IN CHRONIC DISEASES LIKE OBESITY IN THE HISPANIC COMMUNITY.

ADDRESSING FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY AND SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS IN THE GREATER PRINCE WILLIAM AREA AND RAPPAHANNOCK-RAPIDAN HEALTH DISTRICT IN VIRGINIA - THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ADDRESS TWO SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY AND SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS) IN ORDER TO REDUCE HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES, AND IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES RELATED TO BOTH PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH CHRONIC CONDITIONS AMONG IDENTIFIED TARGET POPULATIONS. A LARGE PERCENTAGE OF RESIDENTS IN THE GREATER PRINCE WILLIAM AREA (GPWA) AND RAPPAHANNOCK-RAPIDAN HEALTH DISTRICT (RRHD), LOCATED IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA, ARE MEMBERS OF ONE OR MORE OF THESE TARGET POPULATIONS, WHICH ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY CHRONIC CONDITIONS (OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN POVERTY, MEMBERS OF MINORITIES, INDIVIDUALS WITH MENTAL HEALTH CONCERNS, AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES). THE GREATER PRINCE WILLIAM AREA INCLUDES PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTY AND THE INDEPENDENT CITIES OF MANASSAS AND MANASSAS PARK. THE RAPPAHANNOCK-RAPIDAN HEALTH DISTRICT INCLUDES THE COUNTIES OF FAUQUIER, RAPPAHANNOCK, CULPEPER, MADISON, AND ORANGE. THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT FOR AGING AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES IN COLLABORATION WITH THE PRINCE WILLIAM AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND RAPPAHANNOCK RAPIDAN COMMUNITY SERVICES PROPOSE TO CONVENE AND COORDINATE A LEADERSHIP TEAM CONSISTING OF MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS AND DEVELOP AN IMPLEMENTATION READY SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) ACCELERATOR PLAN FOR THE NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES OF GPWA AND RRHD. OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE INCREASED COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS, AND A COMPLETED IMPLEMENTATION READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN INCLUDING ALL REQUIRED COMPONENTS.

CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLANS - SOCIAL DETERMINANT OF HEALTH (SDOH) NEEDS RELATED TO FOOD INSECURITY, POVERTY AND LACK OF ACCESS TO HEALTH SERVICES SIGNIFICANTLY CONTRIBUTE TO HEALTH DISPARITIES AND IMPACT THE HEALTH OUTCOMES OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN CUMBERLAND COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA.  TO ADDRESS THESE CRITICAL NEEDS, CAROLINA COLLABORATIVE COMMUNITY CARE, INC. (4C) HAS FACILITATED THE CREATION OF A MULTISECTOR SDOH LEADERSHIP TEAM CONSISTING OF KEY COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS, LOCAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, HEALTH SYSTEMS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH THE GOAL OF INCREASING COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS COMMUNITY SECTORS TO IMPROVE SDOH NEEDS. THE SDOH LEADERSHIP TEAM WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY TO CREATE A SHARED, COMPREHENSIVE IMPLEMENTATION READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN, OUTLINING THE STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED TO SUSTAINABLY IMPROVE FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY AND COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES.

CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLANS - ADDRESSING SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH), INCLUDING BUILT ENVIRONMENT AND FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY, HAS THE POTENTIAL TO NARROW DISPARITIES IN MANY CHRONIC DISEASES BY REMOVING SYSTEMIC AND UNFAIR BARRIERS TO PRACTICING HEALTHY BEHAVIORS. THIS ENSURES EVERYONE HAS MORE EQUITABLE OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE HEALTHY CHOICES AND PROMOTES MORE SUSTAINABLE POSITIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES. ACROSS MICHIGAN, COMMUNITIES HAVE BEEN WORKING TO ADDRESS THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH TO REDUCE THE BURDEN OF CHRONIC DISEASE AMONG PEOPLE EXPERIENCING HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INEQUALITY. THOUGH PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE THROUGH THESE EFFORTS, IT IS OFTEN PIECEMEAL, SILOED, AND VARIABLE ACROSS COMMUNITIES. TO BETTER SUPPORT EXISTING EFFORTS, ALIGN WORK ACROSS THE STATE OF MICHIGAN, AND IMPROVE HEALTH AND EQUITY, THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (MDHHS) RECENTLY RELEASED A SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) STRATEGY, MICHIGAN’S ROADMAP TO HEALTHY COMMUNITIES. MICHIGAN’S SDOH STRATEGY TAKES A FOCUSED APPROACH TO IMPROVEMENT PLANNING, ALIGNMENT EFFORTS AT THE STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL, AND SUPPORT FOR INNOVATIVE INITIATIVES TO ADDRESS AND IMPROVE SDOH. IT CONSIDERS STRATEGIES FROM EXISTING STATEWIDE EFFORTS WHILE ALSO INTEGRATING LESSONS LEARNED FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO SUPPORT A SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN WOULD EXPAND THE SCOPE OF THE EXISTING SDOH STRATEGY TO INCLUDE ADDITIONAL FACTORS WITHIN THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT AND FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY, WHILE ADVANCING ITS IMPLEMENTATION THROUGH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS. MDHHS SEEKS TO DEVELOP A SUCCESSFUL ACCELERATOR PLAN THROUGH RAPID REVIEW OF PROGRAMMATIC POLICY WITHIN THE SDOH FOCUS AREAS IDENTIFIED, AN ENVIRONMENTAL SCAN OF NATIONAL BEST PRACTICES TO UTILIZE STATE AND FEDERAL POLICY LEVERS TO SUPPORT EFFORTS TO REDUCE THE BURDEN OF CHRONIC DISEASE, AND A COMPREHENSIVE ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY TO IDENTIFY BARRIERS AND OPPORTUNITIES WITH OUR LOCAL PARTNERS. OVER THE PAST YEAR, THE MDHHS POLICY AND PLANNING TEAM HAS DEVELOPED AN ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE STATEWIDE SDOH STRATEGY. MONTHLY PARTNER MEETINGS ARE CONVENED TO SUPPORT EXPLORATION OF SDOH DOMAINS, AS WELL AS IDENTIFY POLICY LEVER BARRIERS AND OPPORTUNITIES. FUNDING IS BEING SOUGHT TO EXPAND FOCUS AREAS AND TO STRENGTHEN OUR ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY TO ENSURE SOLUTIONS TO REDUCE THE BURDEN OF CHRONIC DISEASE ARE COMMUNITY DRIVEN; PROVIDING MINI-GRANTS TO COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY-LED ENGAGEMENT TO EXPLORE WAYS TO USE THE RESOURCES OF MDHHS TO SUPPORT THE SDOH PRIORITIES IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMUNITY. WITH THE VAST SCOPE OF EXISTING EFFORTS THAT HAVE ALREADY BEEN IDENTIFIED, THE ACCELERATOR PLAN WILL HAVE A STRONG FOUNDATION. ADDITIONAL FUNDING WILL ALLOW FOR ACCELERATION OF THESE EFFORTS, WHILE HAVING A FOCUSED EFFORT ON CHRONIC DISEASE PREVENTION AND MITIGATION.

GLENN ACCELERATOR PROJECT (GAP) SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SODH) - GLENN COUNTY (GC) COMMUNITY ACTION DEPARTMENT (CAD) SEEKS FUNDS FROM THE CDC FOR THE CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLAN GRANT. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT WILL BE TO INCREASE COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS AND WORK COOPERATIVELY TO DEVELOP AN IMPLEMENTATION-READY SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) ACCELERATOR PLAN. THIS PLAN WILL BE IMPLEMENTED ONCE FURTHER FUNDING IS SECURED. THE PLAN WILL ADDRESS SDOH WITHIN GC AND AIM TO IMPROVE CHRONIC DISEASE OUTCOMES OVER TIME. TWO PRIORITY AREAS CHOSEN AS AREAS OF FOCUS ARE 1) FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY AND 2) SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS. COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH INTERACTIVE LEADERSHIP TEAM MEETINGS. THE LEADERSHIP TEAM WILL CONSIST OF MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS INCLUDING HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS, HOSPITAL REPRESENTATIVES, PUBLIC HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES OFFICIALS, COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND HEALTH SYSTEMS COLLABORATIVE (HSC) PARTNERS. THE COMBINED SCOPE OF SERVICES PROVIDED BY LEADERSHIP TEAM MEMBERS IS CONDUCIVE TO A DIVERSE PARTNERSHIP THAT WILL OFFER UNIQUE PERSPECTIVES OF THE CHALLENGES AND HEALTH INEQUITIES EXPERIENCED BY THE TARGET POPULATION. THIS TEAM HAS THE ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY TO EXECUTE PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE ACCELERATOR PLAN. TO SHOWCASE UNITY, OUR LEADERSHIP TEAM DECIDED TO INCLUDE ALL MULTISECTOR PARTNERS ON A SINGLE LETTER OF SUPPORT WHICH MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS OUTLINED IN THE RFA. PLEASE NOTE THE LETTER WAS UPLOADED FOUR TIMES TO ENSURE APPLICATION CRITERIA WAS MET. OUR INTERNAL EVALUATION PROCESS WILL INCLUDE DATA COLLECTION THROUGH DETAILED DOCUMENTATION OF LEADERSHIP MEETING AGENDAS, SURVEYS, MEMBER INPUT AND FEEDBACK. THESE DATA METRICS WILL PROVIDE INSIGHT TO STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT AND PROGRESS OF THE IMPLEMENTATION-READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN.

COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS FOR CHRONIC DISEASE PREVENTION AND CONTROL - THE AIM OF THIS APPLICATION WILL BE TO LAY THE GROUNDWORK AND DEVELOP A PLAN FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A TEAM OF COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKERS TO ADDRESS CHRONIC DISEASE IN JOHNSON COUNTY. THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE CONVENING A LEADERSHIP TEAM OF MULTI-SECTORAL PARTNERS WHO ARE PASSIONATE ABOUT ADDRESSING DISPARITIES IN OUR COMMUNITY AND WHO ARE COMMITTED TO WORKING COLLABORATIVELY TO POOL ASSETS AND EXPERTISE TO AFFECT CHANGE IN THIS WAY. THIS MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAM WILL THEN WORK, WITH GUIDANCE FROM THE CDC AND FACILITATION BY JCPH, TO CREATE AN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN TO INITIATE A COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER PROGRAM WITHIN THE COUNTY TO ADDRESS CHRONIC DISEASE IN COUNTY POPULATIONS DISPROPORTIONATELY AFFECTED BY BARRIERS TO THEIR CARE AND PREVENTION EFFORTS. IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS PLAN, THE PROJECT LEADERS WILL ADDRESS AT LEAST TWO OF THE DETERMINANTS IDENTIFIED IN THE CHRONIC DISEASE FRAMEWORK DEVELOPED BY THE CDC: COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES AND SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS OPPORTUNITY IS TO ACHIEVE THE SHORT-TERM OUTCOMES OF: 1) CONVENE AND COORDINATE A LEADERSHIP TEAM OF MULTI-SECTORAL PARTNERS AND INCREASE THE COLLABORATION 2) DEVELOP AN IMPLEMENTATION READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN  THE CATCHMENT AREA WILL BE JOHNSON COUNTY, IOWA AND POPULATIONS WILL BE IDENTIFIED THROUGH DEMOGRAPHICS AND KNOWLEDGE OF THE COMMUNITY AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS. OVERALL, THE FOLLOWING MILESTONES HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED TO ACCOMPLISH THIS PROJECT: - CONVENE A WORKGROUP OF COMMUNITY AGENCIES AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS - DEFINE THE COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER ROLE AND SCOPE OF PRACTICE, ALONG WITH FORMAL EDUCATIONAL NEEDS FOR THE POSITION - UTILIZE SOCIAL VULNERABILITY INDEX (SVI) DATA TO EXAMINE AND DOCUMENT EXISTING COMMUNITY AND SYSTEMIC BARRIERS THAT IMPACT COMMUNITY CLINICAL LINKAGES AND SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS - IDENTIFY ACTIVITIES AND OPPORTUNITIES WHERE A COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER MAY ADDRESS THESE BARRIERS - IDENTIFY MODELS OF FUNDING TO SUPPORT CONTINUING IMPLEMENTATION OF A COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER PROGRAM - IDENTIFY PROCESSES TO SUSTAIN THE LEADERSHIP TEAM - IDENTIFY ELEMENTS OF INFRASTRUCTURE THAT WILL BE REQUIRED TO SUPPORT THE ONGOING EFFORTS OF THE PROGRAM - IDENTIFY APPROPRIATE MEASURES WITHIN THE SERVED POPULATIONS IN ORDER TO GAUGE A BASELINE OF HEALTH STATUS AND ENABLE THE WORKGROUP TO ADEQUATELY MEASURE OUTCOMES AFTER IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROGRAM - IDENTIFY A PRE-DETERMINED TEAM OF COMMUNITY PROVIDERS WHO WOULD BE INTERESTED IN DEVELOPING A WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH THE PROGRAM TO UTILIZE ITS SERVICES

2022 COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PLAN CREATION, DEVELOPMENT, AND PROCESS EVALUATION - COMMUNITY HEALTH ISSUES ARE TOO LARGE FOR ANY SINGLE ORGANIZATION TO ADDRESS. ELEVEN HEALTH CARE ORGANIZATIONS CAME TOGETHER TO CREATE THE NORTHLAND HEALTH ALLIANCE (NHA) WITH THE IDEA TO BRING ORGANIZATIONS AND COLLECTIVELY ADDRESS THE HEALTH PROBLEMS AS A SINGLE UNIT. THE NHA CONDUCTED A COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT IN 2021 AND IS NOW TASKED WITH THE CREATION OF THE COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PLAN (CHIP). THE AIM OF THE COMPLETED CHIP WILL BE TO ACCELERATE THE PROGRESS BEING MADE IN COMBATING THE HEALTH INEQUITIES THROUGH A FOCUSED EFFORT ON THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH. THROUGH FACILITATED MEETINGS ATTENDED BY REPRESENTATIVES OF EACH MEMBER ORGANIZATION, THE NHA, ALONG WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS WITH INTEREST IN THE PRIORITY AREAS, WILL CREATE A COMMUNITY HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PLAN (CHIP) TO ACCELERATE THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE SELECTED PRIORITY AREAS. THE GOAL BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD IS 1) HAVE A COMPLETED PLAN TO ADDRESS A. THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT, B. SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS, AND C. FOOD INSECURITY, AND 2) INCREASE COLLABORATION AMONG COMMUNITY PARTNERS IN THE NORTHLAND WHO HAVE A VESTED INTEREST IN IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITY.

SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN - HENDERSON COUNTY RURAL HEALTH CENTER, INC, DOING BUSINESS AS EAGLE VIEW COMMUNITY HEALTH SYSTEM (EVCHS) SERVES A FIVE COUNTY AREA COMPRISED OF HENDERSON COUNTY, MERCER COUNTY, MCDONOUGH COUNTY, AND WARREN COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL ILLINOIS; AND DES MOINES COUNTY, IOWA. EAGLE VIEW INTENDS TO COLLABORATE WITH MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS TO DEVELOP AN IMPLEMENTATION READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN TO REDUCE DISPARITIES IN HEALTH OUTCOMES RELATED TO CHRONIC DISEASE WITHIN THE CATCHMENT AREA, SPECIFICALLY IN THE PRIORITY AREAS OF COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES AND FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH REGULAR MEETINGS OF THE LEADERSHIP TEAM THAT HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED FOR THIS PROJECT, AS WELL AS THROUGH THE RECRUITMENT OF ADDITIONAL VESTED PARTNERS. THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF THE LEADERSHIP TEAM, THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED:  INCREASED COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS.  IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN AMONG MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS.  IMPROVED HEALTH AND SOCIAL OUTCOMES FOR PEOPLE EXPERIENCING HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES.  COMPLETING AN IMPLEMENTATION READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN, INCLUDING ALL REQUIRED COMPONENTS.  ESTABLISHMENT OF INFRASTRUCTURE AND FUNDING TO SUPPORT SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN IMPLEMENTATION.  REDUCED HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCREASED HEALTH EQUITY.  ONGOING DATA COLLECTION AND EVALUATION WILL INFORM THE CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT OF THE PROJECT.

BUILDING FOUNDATIONS OF COMMUNITY HEALTH IN HARVEY COUNTY - HARVEY COUNTY, KANSAS, IS A COMMUNITY OF THE METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA (MSA) OF WICHITA, YET ALSO CONSIDERED A RURAL COUNTY WITH ONLY ONE MUNICIPALITY IN HARVEY COUNTY HAVING A POPULATION HIGHER THAN 3,900. THE COUNTY’S POPULATION IS 33,817; 93.5% OF THE RESIDENTS ARE WHITE AND 12.1% ARE HISPANIC. 19.8% OF THE POPULATION IS OVER 65 YEARS OF AGE AND 24% ARE UNDER 18 (US CENSUS QUICK FACTS). UPON DEEPER REVIEW OF THE SOCIAL VULNERABILITY INDEX (SVI), THE TARGET POPULATION FOR THIS SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN RESIDES IN NEWTON AND NORTH NEWTON, KANSAS. THE ESTIMATED POPULATION OF NEWTON AND NORTH NEWTON IS 20,262 OR 60% OF THE COUNTY’S POPULATION (US CENSUS CITY & TOWN POPULATION). LIMITED AFFORDABLE HOUSING OPTIONS, UNMET BEHAVIORAL HEALTH NEEDS, AND HIGH RATES OF CHRONIC DISEASE REFLECT THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) SITUATION OF THE TARGET POPULATION. HARVEY COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (HCHD) HAS A STRONG FOUNDATION READY TO SPRING INTO THE SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN PROCESS. EMPLOYING THE EXISTING STRUCTURE OF THE HEALTHY HARVEY COALITION (HHC) AND IDENTIFIED STAKEHOLDERS TO JOIN THE PROCESS, INCLUDING RESIDENTS FROM THE TARGET POPULATION, HCHD AND HHC WILL CREATE A LEADERSHIP TEAM TO DEVELOP A SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN. THIS PLAN WILL ADDRESS THE CDC’S SDOH PRIORITY AREAS OF “COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES” AND “SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS”. THE PLAN WILL BE DRIVEN BY THE ‘LIVED-EXPERIENCES’ (QUALITATIVE DATA) OF THE TARGET POPULATION, COUNTY-SPECIFIC QUANTITATIVE DATA, AND BEST PRACTICES/EVIDENCE-BASED STRATEGIES. AN ADDITIONAL OUTCOME OF THE GRANT PERIOD WILL BE INCREASED COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS.

CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH - PLANNING - THE BUTLER COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (BCHD) IS LOCATED IN POPLAR BLUFF, MO. POPLAR BLUFF IS THE COUNTY SEAT OF BUTLER COUNTY, MO. BUTLER COUNTY HAS A TOTAL POPULATION OF 42,478. WITHIN BUTLER COUNTY THERE IS ONE LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT; TWO (2) HOSPITALS; AND ONE (1) FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER (FQHC).  IN A SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH SCREENING, OUR FQHC PARTNER FOUND CLIENTS HAD DIFFICULTY GETTING: UTILITIES (26%), FOOD (23%), A PHONE (15%), CLOTHING (12%) AND/OR CHILDCARE (2%) WITH 32% OF HOMES WITHOUT BROADBAND. WHILE THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND SEVERAL PARTNERING AGENCIES SCREEN FOR SDOH, RESOURCES TO ADDRESS SOCIAL NEEDS IN OUR AREA ARE LIMITED AND CHANGE FREQUENTLY, MAKING MULTISECTOR INFORMATION EXCHANGES AND CO-IMPLEMENTATION OF ONGOING INITIATIVES TO ADDRESS THE UNDERLYING ISSUES MORE IMPORTANT.   THE BUTLER COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT WILL ADDRESS ISSUES IN OUT COMMUNITY THAT IMPACT PUBLIC HEALTH, INCLUDING POLICY, SYSTEM, ENVIRONMENTAL AND PROGRAMMATIC STRATEGIES THAT ADDRESS SDOH. THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT ALREADY HAS A SOLID FOUNDATION WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS THAT WORK TOWARDS PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS THE FIVE (5) SDOH DOMAINS: ECONOMIC STABILITY, EDUCATION ACCESS AND QUALITY, HEALTHCARE ACCESS AND QUALITY, NEIGHBORHOOD AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT AND SOCIAL AND COMMUNITY CONTEXT. BCHD WORKS CLOSELY WITH SOCIAL SERVICE, HEALTH CARE, EDUCATIONAL AND BUSINESS ENTITIES THROUGH THE BUTLER COUNTY COMMUNITY RESOURCE COUNCIL. TOGETHER THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE PART OF THE BUTLER COUNTY WELLNESS COUNCIL.

OGLE COUNTY'S CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLAN - THE OGLE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (OCHD) IS APPLYING FOR THE “CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLAN” FUNDING FROM THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION TO ADDRESS HIGHER BURDEN OF CHRONIC DISEASE IN LEE, OGLE, AND WHITESIDE COUNTIES IN RURAL NORTHERN ILLINOIS. OCHD PLANS TO PARTNER WITH PROJECT OPEN, AN EXPERIENCED COALITION OF HEALTHCARE, PUBLIC HEALTH, LAW ENFORCEMENT, BUSINESS, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND OTHER SERVICES AGENCIES LOCATED IN THE THREE COUNTIES. THIS OPPORTUNITY OFFERS $125,000 TO COMPLETE A PLAN TO ADDRESS CHRONIC DISEASE TARGETING TWO OR MORE SOCIAL DETERMINATES OF HEALTH STRATEGIES (BUILT ENVIRONMENTAL, COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES, FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY, SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS AND TOBACCO-FREE POLICY). THE LOCAL COLLATION PLANS TO ADDRESS BUILT ENVIRONMENTAL AND FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY AS THE PRIMARY DOMAINS FOR THE PLANNING PROCESS. ALL THREE COUNTIES WITHIN THE CATCHMENT AREA HAVE HIGHER RATES OF HEART DISEASE, OBESITY, DIABETES, AND CANCER THAN STATE AND NATIONAL AVERAGES. THIS CATCHMENT AREA ALSO REPORTS A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF POOR OR FAIR HEALTH DAYS COMPARED TO THE STATE AND NATIONAL AVERAGE. BEING RURAL AREAS THE THREE COUNTIES HAVE LIMITED ACCESS TO RECREATIONAL RESOURCES ESPECIALLY IN THE MORE REMOTE AREAS. THESE SAME AREAS HAVE ISSUES WITH ACCESS TO HEALTHY NUTRIENT DENSE FOODS. SEVERAL TOWNS IN THESE COUNTIES REQUIRE RESIDENTS TO TRAVEL MORE THAN TEN MILES TO REACH THE CLOSES GROCERY STORE. THE PARTNERS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROJECT WILL LOOK AT HEALTH DISPARITIES AND WAYS TO REDUCE INEQUITIES THAT DRIVE RISK FACTORS THE IMPACT CHRONIC DISEASE. THE OGLE COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT INTEND TO WORK WITH PROJECT OPEN, A PREEXISTING LOCAL COALITION, TO FURTHER EVALUATE ISSUES RELATED TO CHRONIC DISEASE. THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND THE COALITION WILL WORK TO FIND ROOT CAUSES, STRENGTHEN PARTNERSHIPS, UNDERSTAND POLICY IMPROVEMENTS, ASSESS BUILT ENVIRONMENTS, AND ULTIMATELY CREATE A PLAN THAT WILL ADDRESS POOR CHRONIC DISEASE OUTCOMES.

HEALTHY CATTARAUGUS PARTNERSHIP, CATTARAUGUS COMMUNITY ACTION IN CONJUNCTION WITH CATTARAUGUS COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT, SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLAN 2022. - CATTARAUGUS COUNTY IS A LARGE (1309 SQ. MI.), PRIMARILY RURAL COUNTY SITUATED IN SOUTHWESTERN NEW YORK, ALONG THE PENNSYLVANIA BORDER. THERE ARE TWO CITIES, OLEAN AND SALAMANCA, WITH POPULATIONS OF APPROXIMATELY 13,670 AND 5,497 RESPECTIVELY (2019 ESTIMATES), IN ADDITION TO 9 VILLAGES AND 32 TOWNS LOCATED IN CATTARAUGUS COUNTY, PER THE MOST RECENT ACS DATA 2020).  CATTARAUGUS COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. (CCA) IS A PRIVATE, NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION FORMED IN 1965 IN RESPONSE TO THE WAR ON POVERTY. CCA IS HEADQUARTERED ON THE SENECA NATION OF INDIAN’S TERRITORY IN SALAMANCA, NY WHERE CCA WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE SENECA NATION. CATTARAUGUS COMMUNITY ACTION (CCA) PARTNERS WITH THE COMMUNITY TO PROVIDE STRENGTHS-BASED OPPORTUNITIES FOR VULNERABLE PEOPLE TO ACHIEVE ECONOMIC, PHYSICAL, AND EMOTIONAL SECURITY. CCA PROVIDES SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME AND DISENFRANCHISED PEOPLE IN EIGHT BASIC CATEGORIES. THESE ARE ENERGY CONSERVATION, EMERGENCY AND HOMELESS SERVICES, HOUSING, NUTRITION, VICTIM SERVICES, YOUTH PROGRAMS, PARENT SUPPORT AND MENTAL HEALTH.  THE AGENCY HAS AN ANNUAL BUDGET OF APPROXIMATELY $10 MILLION.  THE AGENCY HAS A CLEARLY DEMONSTRATED HISTORY OF SUCCESSFULLY MANAGING A VARIETY OF FUNDS FROM MULTIPLE FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND PRIVATE SOURCES.  CATTARAUGUS COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT IS HEADQUARTERED IN OLEAN, NY (CATTARAUGUS COUNTY) AND MAINTAINS A CLOSE PARTNERSHIP WITH CATTARAUGUS COMMUNITY ACTION. THE CATTARAUGUS COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT’S MISSION IS TO ENGAGE AND EMPOWER THE PUBLIC OF ALL AGES TO LIVE HEALTHIER LIFESTYLES THROUGH EFFORTS OF EDUCATION, PREVENTION, MONITORING, ACCESSIBILITY, AFFORDABILITY, TECHNOLOGY, TESTING, DIAGNOSING, AND TREATING.  THE SELECTION OF PRIORITY AREAS FOR THIS PROPOSAL, INVOLVED CCA LOOKING AT THE RESULTS OF OUR OWN INTERNAL NEEDS ASSESSMENT AS WELL AS THE CATTARAUGUS COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH’S COMMUNITY HEALTH ASSESSMENT (CHA). ONE OF THE MAIN AREAS OF CONCERN FOR CATTARAUGUS COUNTY RESIDENTS THAT WERE SURVEYED INCLUDED THE LACK OF NUTRITIOUS FOODS AS WELL AS THE INCREASE IN CHRONIC DISEASE WITH EMPHASIS BEING PLACED ON LINKAGES/OUTREACH. THEREFORE, SDOH PRIORITY AREAS SELECTED FOR THIS PROPOSAL INCLUDE: 1) FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY 2) COMMUNITY CLINICAL LINKAGES. CCA AND THE CATTARAUGUS COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT (CCHD) OBTAIN THE CRITICAL COUNTY WIDE DATA THROUGH THE COMMUNITY HEALTH ASSESSMENT AND SURVEYS, WHILE CCA OBTAINS AND COLLECTS SIMILAR INFORMATION VIA SURVEYS AND A TRIENNIAL NEEDS ASSESSMENT. AN ESTABLISHED LEADERSHIP TEAM HAS BEEN DEVELOPED AS WELL AS RESOURCES TO IMPLEMENT AN SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN THAT FOCUSES ON 1) FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY AND 2) COMMUNITY CLINICAL LINKAGES AS THE TWO MAIN DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH PRIORITY AREAS. WHILE THE TWO PRIORITY AREAS ARE THE PRIORITY AREAS, CCA AND CCHD WILL CONSIDER ALL 5 SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF PLANNING AND OUTREACH.

THE PHILADELPHIA SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN - PHILADELPHIA IS A LARGE, DIVERSE CITY FACING HEAVY BURDENS OF POVERTY, CHRONIC DISEASE, AND INEQUALITY. THE PHILADELPHIA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH PROPOSES TO CONVENE AND COORDINATE A MULTISECTORAL TEAM OF STAKEHOLDERS IN THE PHILADELPHIA COMMUNITY TO ADDRESS SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH WITHIN THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT AND COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES. THE PHL SDOH LEADERSHIP TEAM INCLUDES THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT, OTHER CITY AGENCIES, ESTABLISHED TASK FORCE AND ADVISORY COUNCILS, HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITY LEGAL SERVICES, THE PHILADELPHIA HEALTH INFORMATION EXCHANGE, AND NON-PROFIT EXPERTS IN PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAM DELIVERY, QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, AND SERVICE COORDINATION. PLANS WILL BE DEVELOPED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITIES THAT FACE DISPARITIES IN CHRONIC DISEASE AND RELATED RISK FACTORS—BLACK AND HISPANIC PHILADELPHIANS AND SIX GEOGRAPHIC REGIONS OF THE CITY: NORTH PHILADELPHIA EAST, NORTH PHILADELPHIA WEST, FAR NORTH PHILADELPHIA, THE RIVER WARDS, WEST PHILADELPHIA, AND SOUTHWEST PHILADELPHIA WHOSE NEEDS WERE HIGHLIGHTED IN THE 2022 PHILADELPHIA COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS ASSESSMENT.  WITH THE AIM OF DEVELOPING A SUSTAINABLE AND IMPLEMENTATION READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN THE PHL SDOH LEADERSHIP TEAM WILL 1) DEFINE THE SCOPE OF DISPARITIES IN CHRONIC DISEASE OUTCOMES AND THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH IN PHILADELPHIA, 2) IDENTIFY AND MAP EXISTING COMMUNITY ASSETS AND ONGOING PROGRAMS OPERATED BY THE SDOH LEADERSHIP TEAM PARTNERS, 3) INCLUDE AND RESPOND TO THE INPUT AND COLLABORATION OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS, 4) IDENTIFY GAPS IN ASSETS AND SERVICES, 5) COORDINATE EFFORTS, 6) DEVELOP NEW STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THESE INEQUALITIES, 7) ALIGN PARTNER RESOURCES AND CAPACITIES, AND 8) PLAN TO EVALUATE THE IMPACT OF THIS WORK.

CLOSING THE GAP WITH SDOH ACCELERATOR PLANS IN HAMILTON COUNTY - CHRONIC DISEASES ARE THE LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH AND DISABILITY IN HAMILTON COUNTY, OHIO. SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) ARE FACTORS IN WHICH PEOPLE LIVE, WORK, LEARN, PLAY, AND WORSHIP THAT IMPACT THE OPPORTUNITY TO ACCESS THE RESOURCES NEEDED TO LIVE A HEALTHY LIFE. INEQUITIES IN SDOH DISPROPORTIONALLY IMPACT THE BURDEN AND HEALTH OUTCOMES RELATED TO CHRONIC DISEASES ESPECIALLY WITHIN HIGH CONCENTRATED DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES IN HAMILTON COUNTY. ADDRESSING SDOH THROUGH POLICY, SYSTEMS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE STRATEGIES UTILIZING THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION FRAMEWORK ALLOWS HAMILTON COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH (HCPH) TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS THE ROOT CAUSE OF CHRONIC DISEASE RELATED HEALTH DISPARITIES SEEN IN HAMILTON COUNTY.  HCPH WILL CONVENE A MULTISECTORAL LEADERSHIP TEAM TO DEVELOP AN SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN THAT IDENTIFIES SPECIFIC MEANINGFUL AND IMPACTFUL STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS SDOH WITHIN THE HIGH CONCENTRATED DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES. THE SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN WILL INCLUDE POLICY, SYSTEM, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND PROGRAMMATIC STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING SDOH PRIORITY AREAS THAT IMPACT CHRONIC DISEASE BURDEN AND HEALTH OUTCOMES: BUILT ENVIRONMENT; FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY; SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS; AND TOBACCO-FREE POLICIES. BY SEPTEMBER 29, 2023, HCPH WILL (1) INCREASE COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS MULTISECTORAL PARTNERS TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND SOCIAL OUTCOMES FOR PEOPLE EXPERIENCING HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES; AND (2) DEVELOP ONE IMPLEMENTATION READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN THAT, ONCE IMPLEMENTED, WILL LEAD TO REDUCED HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCREASED HEALTH EQUITY WITHIN HAMILTON COUNTY, ESPECIALLY WITHIN HIGH CONCENTRATED DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.  HEALTH EQUITY AND THE HEALTH STATUS OF A PERSON ARE INFLUENCED BY MANY FACTORS. ONE WAY TO LOOK AT HOW SEVERAL FACTORS INFLUENCE THE HEALTH OF A PERSON AND COMMUNITY IS TO LOOK AT THE LEVEL OF CONCENTRATED DISADVANTAGE. CONCENTRATED DISADVANTAGE IS AN EFFECTIVE MEASURE THAT CONSIDERS ASPECTS OF POVERTY. IT IS AN INDICATOR THAT MEASURES A COMMUNITY’S LEVEL OF ECONOMIC DISADVANTAGE, CALCULATED USING THE COMMUNITY’S PERCENTAGE OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING WITH FIVE INDICATORS: (1) BELOW THE POVERTY LINE; (2) ON PUBLIC ASSISTANCE; (3) FEMALE-HEADED HOUSEHOLDS; (4) UNEMPLOYED; AND (5) YOUNGER THAN 18. HCPH IDENTIFIED HIGH CONCENTRATED DISADVANTAGE COMMUNITIES WITHIN HCPH’S JURISDICTION AS THE TARGET POPULATION FOR THIS PROPOSAL. PRIORITY HIGH CONCENTRATED DISADVANTAGE COMMUNITIES INCLUDE LINCOLN HEIGHTS, LOCKLAND, NORTH COLLEGE HILL, ADDYSTON, CHEVIOT, MT. HEALTHY, ELMWOOD PLACE, WOODLAWN, ARLINGTON HEIGHTS, AND GOLF MANOR.  HCPH UNDERSTANDS THE IMPORTANCE AND ROLE SDOH HAVE ON THE HEALTH OF RESIDENTS AND THE OVERALL COMMUNITY. HCPH’S WETHRIVE! INITIATIVE WAS CREATED IN 2009, TO PARTNER WITH COMMUNITIES, SCHOOLS, AND CHILDCARE PROVIDERS TO IDENTIFY THE UNIQUE NEEDS WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITY OR SCHOOL TO ENSURE THAT ALL INDIVIDUALS OF CAN THRIVE AND ADDRESS PRIORITIES THAT THREATEN OR LIMIT OPTIMAL HEALTH. WETHRIVE SUCCESS HAS BEEN BUILT ON LEARNING TO TAP INTO THE COLLECTIVE INTELLIGENCE OF THE COMMUNITY.  KEY STAFF AND PARTNERS ARE NOT ONLY IN PLACE BUT ARE TRAINED AND HAVE THE NECESSARY RELATIONSHIPS CRUCIAL TO SUCCESSFULLY ADVANCING THESE EFFORTS. MCNDH CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLAN PROJECT - THE MUSCOGEE (CREEK) NATION (MCN), THE FOURTH LARGEST FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE IN THE UNITED STATES, IS PROPOSING THE MCN CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLANS. MCN TRIBAL HEADQUARTERS ARE CENTRALLY SITUATED WITHIN THE NATION’S JURISDICTION IN THE CITY OF OKMULGEE AND CONSIST OF AN 11 COUNTY RESERVATION AREA. THE SERVICE AREA CONSISTS OF URBAN, RURAL, AND VERY RURAL-REMOTE AREAS. POPULATION DENSITIES VARY BY SMALL UNINCORPORATED COMMUNITIES, WITH FEWER THAN 50 RESIDENTS, TO TULSA, ONE OF THE LARGEST URBAN AREAS WITHIN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THE MUSCOGEE (CREEK) NATION DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (MCNDH) IS REQUESTING A TOTAL FEDERAL AMOUNT OF $125,000 FOR THE LIFE OF THE G RANT TO ENHANCE THE TRIBAL CITIZEN’S PATIENT CARE AND WELL-BEING. MCNDH WILL SERVE AMERICAN INDIANS/ALASKAN NATIVES WITHIN THE MCN RESERVATION AS WELL AS OTHER PARTNERSHIP COLLABORATIONS. MCNDH’S IS TO CREATE AND IMPLEMENT A SOCIAL DOMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLAN THAT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: I.	BACKGROUND II.	PARTNERSHIPS III.	IDENTIFY PROGRAMS AND RESOURCES AVAILABLE FOR SDOH IV.	DESCRIBE APPROACH V.	EVALUATION PLAN VI.	DATA INTEGRATION VII.	RESPONSIBLE PARTY VIII.	IMPLEMENTATION PLAN IX.	SUSTAINABILITY/FUNDING STRATEGY X.	SUCCESS STORY

SOUTH EL MONTE - CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLAN - THE CITY OF SOUTH EL MONTE HAS MADE GREAT PROGRESS IN ADDRESSING SEVERAL SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH OVER THE PAST 20 YEARS, THE ONSET OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS EXACERBATED REALITY FOR MANY AS WELL AS ERODED SOME OF THE CITY’S PROGRESS. AS A RESULT, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL FOCUS ON ADDRESSING THREE OF THE CDC IDENTIFIED SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH, WHICH ARE (1) FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY, (2) SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS, AND (3) TOBACCO FREE POLICIES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE THE CITY OF SOUTH EL MONTE WITH AN IMPLEMENTATION-READY ACCELERATOR PLAN TO ADDRESS THE THREE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH INFORMED BY THE COMMUNITY WHO WILL BENEFIT DIRECTLY.

LEWIS AND CLARK COUNTY HEALTHY COMMUNITIES COALITION LEADERSHIP TEAM AND SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN - THE HEALTHY COMMUNITIES COALITION’S PROPOSED PROJECT AIMS TO PREVENT AND REDUCE THE IMPACTS OF CHRONIC DISEASE BY CREATING AN ACCELERATOR PLAN TO COMBAT SOCIAL DETERMINANT OF HEALTH (SDOH) ISSUES IN LEWIS AND CLARK COUNTY, MONTANA.  THE HEALTHY COMMUNITIES COALITION (COALITION) COORDINATED BY LEWIS AND CLARK PUBLIC HEALTH HAS A RICH HISTORY OF COLLABORATION AND ACTION.  THE COALITION MEMBERS EXAMINE PROGRAMS AND CONDITIONS ALREADY EXISTING IN THE COMMUNITY AND SEEK TO IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR IMPROVED POLICY, SYSTEM, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE.  THE DIVERSE MEMBERSHIP ON THE COALITION INCLUDES CITY, COUNTY, AND STATE GOVERNMENT; NON-PROFITS; LOCAL BUSINESSES; HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS; AND INDIVIDUAL RESIDENTS IN TARGET POPULATIONS.  THE COALITION HAS ACCOMPLISHED NUMEROUS SYSTEM-WIDE CHANGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: TOBACCO FREE PARKS, TOBACCO POINT OF SALE ORDINANCES, COMPLETE STREETS POLICY, SUN SAFETY CAMPAIGNS, SUN HATS FOR NEWBORN BABIES STRATEGY, AND AN ACTIVE LIVING WAYFINDING PLAN. USING THE FUNDING OPPORTUNITY FROM THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION’S CLOSING THE GAP WITH SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH ACCELERATOR PLANS PROGRAM, LEWIS AND CLARK PUBLIC HEALTH WILL CREATE A STRONG, INCLUSIVE, AND INTERDISCIPLINARY LEADERSHIP TEAM FOR THE COALITION. THIS WILL LEAD TO A MORE IMPACTFUL, ACTIVE, AND SUSTAINABLE COALITION.  ONCE ESTABLISHED, THE COALITION LEADERSHIP TEAM WILL HIRE A CONSULTANT TO HELP DEVELOP A SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN. THIS PLAN WILL LEAD THE COALITION TO A MEANINGFUL ACTION PLAN BASED ON THE DATA AND NEEDS. THE LEADERSHIP TEAM WILL ALSO ORGANIZE A TRAINING FOR THE ENTIRE COALITION TO BETTER UNDERSTAND SDOH AND HEALTH EQUITY. THE TARGET POPULATION FOR THE SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN WILL THE COUNTY’S MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS THAT ARE MOST LIKELY TO EXPERIENCE HEALTH DISPARITIES, INCLUDING RURAL RESIDENTS, AMERICAN INDIANS, SENIORS, LGBT, AND PEOPLE LIVING WITH A DISABILITY.  PURPOSE A MULTISECTORAL LEADERSHIP TEAM MADE UP OF 10 LEADERS FROM AN INTERDISCIPLINARY AND INCLUSIVE BACKGROUNDS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP A SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN TO ADDRESS THE PRIORITY AREAS OF COMMUNITY-CLINICAL LINKAGES, BUILT ENVIRONMENT, AND FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY. THE TARGET POPULATIONS FOR THE SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN ARE RURAL RESIDENTS, AMERICAN INDIANS, SENIORS, LGBT, AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.  OUTCOMES 1.	BY SEPTEMBER 30, 2023, THE HEALTHY COMMUNITIES COALITION WILL HAVE INCREASED COLLABORATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACROSS A TEN-PERSON, MULTI-SECTOR LEADERSHIP PLANNING TEAM. 2.	BY SEPTEMBER 30, 2023, THE HEALTHY COMMUNITIES COALITION WILL HAVE A COMPLETED, IMPLEMENTATION-READY SDOH ACCELERATOR PLAN THAT INCLUDES ALL REQUIRED COMPONENTS.

ACHIEVING EQUITY FOR DISEASE PREVENTION IN CYSTIC FIBROSIS (ACED-CF) - CYSTIC FIBROSIS (CF) IS AN INHERITED, LIFELONG DISORDER THAT REQUIRES MEDICAL CARE THROUGHOUT THE LIFESPAN.  ONE OF THE MOST COMMON LIFE-SHORTENING MONOGENIC DISORDERS, IT IS CHARACTERIZED BY CHRONIC PROGRESSIVE LUNG DISEASE AND PANCREATIC EXOCRINE AND ENDOCRINE INSUFFICIENCY.  ADVANCES IN CYSTIC FIBROSIS (CF) DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT, INCLUDING NEWBORN SCREENING (NBS) AND CFTR MODULATOR THERAPIES, HAVE TRANSFORMED PROGNOSIS FROM SEVERELY REDUCED LIFESPAN TO A CHRONIC DISEASE OF ADULTS WITH RAPIDLY INCREASING LIFE EXPECTANCY. NEWBORN SCREENING FOR CF IMPROVES GROWTH, WHICH PREDICTS IMPROVED PULMONARY FUNCTION AND SURVIVAL.  WHILE CF IS AN AUTOSOMAL RECESSIVE GENETIC DISEASE WITH PRENATAL DISEASE MANIFESTATIONS, ADVANCES IN NBS AND EXTENSION OF HIGHLY EFFECTIVE CFTR MODULATOR THERAPIES TO CHILDREN WITH CF, THE DISEASE MANIFESTATIONS OF CYSTIC FIBROSIS ARE LARGELY PREVENTABLE.  WE HAVE DISCOVERED THAT IMPLEMENTATION OF UNIVERSAL SCREENING IN THE US HAS NOT MET THE GOAL OF INITIATING TREATMENT FOR CF WITHIN 30 DAYS OF AGE. IN A STUDY FUNDED BY A CYSTIC FIBROSIS FOUNDATION (CFF) GRANT AND USING CFF PATIENT REGISTRY DATA , 23% OF 6354 INFANTS WITH CF BORN 2010-2018 HAD INITIAL CF CENTER EVALUATION (AGE AT FIRST EVENT, AFE) > 30 DAYS OF AGE, AND 10% HAD AFE > 60DAYS. FURTHERMORE, THE MEDIAN AFE FOR INFANTS WHO ARE BLACK, INDIGENOUS AND PEOPLE OF COLOR (BIPOC) IS LATER THAN THAT OF WHITE, NOT HISPANIC INFANTS (31 DAYS V 22 DAYS, P<.001).  LATER AFE LATER AFE IS ASSOCIATED WITH LOWER WEIGHT FOR AGE Z-SCORE AT 1 YEAR OF AGE.  STRUCTURED INTERVIEWS, STATE NBS PROGRAM PERSONNEL AND CF CENTER DIRECTORS IDENTIFIED EDUCATION OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN AND PARENTS AS THE MOST IMPORTANT TARGET TO PREVENT DELAYS IN REFERRAL AFTER A POSITIVE NBS FOR CF.  THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO OVERCOME CURRENT DELAYS IN INITIATING TREATMENT FOR CF THROUGH DISSEMINATION OF STUDY FINDINGS AND DISTRIBUTION OF STATE SPECIFIC CFF PATIENT REGISTRY DATA ON CARE PROCESSES AND PATIENT OUTCOMES TO STATE NBS PROGRAM PERSONNEL AND CF CENTER DIRECTORS.  SURVEYS WILL BE DEPLOYED TO PARENTS OF CHILDREN WITH CF AND TO GENERAL POPULATION PARENTS TO FILL KEY KNOWLEDGE GAPS IN EXPERIENCES AND KNOWLEDGE OF NEWBORN SCREENING.  PARTNERING WITH NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ACADEMIC COLLABORATORS, WE WILL DEVELOP A PUBLIC AWARENESS CAMPAIGN FOCUSED ON NEWBORN SCREENING AND THE NEED FOR TIMELY EVALUATION AFTER AN OUT-OF RANGE TEST RESULT.  WE WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT CONTINUING MEDICAL EDUCATION AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENT ACTIVITIES, ELIGIBLE FOR MAINTENANCE OF CERTIFICATION BY THE AMERICAN BOARD OF PEDIATRICS, FOR PRIMARY CARE PEDIATRICIANS, PROVIDING IT AT NO COST TO PARTICIPATING PHYSICIANS.

ADDRESSING CHRONIC OBSTRUCTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE - THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION IS SUBMITTING “ADDRESSING CHRONIC LUNG DISEASE PROJECT” PROPOSAL IN RESPONSE TO THE CDC’S NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY,CDC-RFA-DP21-2112. CHRONIC OBSTRUCTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE (COPD) PREVENTION AND TREATMENT MEASURES HAS LONG BEEN PART OF OUR ORGANIZATION’S GOAL TO REDUCE THE BURDEN OF LUNG DISEASE. COPDINITIATIVES ARE IMPLEMENTEDWITH EDUCATION, BEHAVIOR MODIFICATION, HEALTH SYSTEMS CHANGE, ADVOCACY AND RESEARCH STRATEGIES TO ENSURE A COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH. IN ADDITION, THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION SHARES AND SUPPORTS THE HEALTHY PEOPLE 2030 AND COPD NATIONAL ACTION PLAN GOALS TO ENSURE COLLABORATION ACROSS ALL TACTICS.  THE AMERICAN LUNG ASSOCIATION’S APPROACH TO THIS OPPORTUNITY WILLIMPLEMENTLUNG DISEASE PUBLIC HEALTH BEST PRACTICESIN COLLABORATION WITH OUR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS. KEYSTONES FOR SUCCESS WILL INCLUDE THE ENGAGEMENT OF OUR ESTABLISHED COPD PATIENT ADVISORY BOARD, AIRWAYS CLINICAL RESEARCH CENTERS, NATIONAL PARTNERS, AND THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION.  THE PROJECT WILL UTILIZE A COORDINATED, COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH TO IMPROVE PREVENTION, EARLY DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND MANAGEMENT OF COPD.

THE IARC HANDBOOKS OF CANCER PREVENTION - EVIDENCE-BASED EVALUATIONS OF PRIMARY AND SECONDARY CANCER PREVENTION APPROACHES - THE IARC HANDBOOKS OF CANCER PREVENTION PROVIDE AN EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACH TO IDENTIFY WHICH INTERVENTIONS OR STRATEGIES CAN PREVENT CANCER OR DETECT CANCER AT AN EARLY STAGE. THE EVALUATIONS OF THE IARC HANDBOOKS ARE WIDELY USED BY NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL HEALTH AGENCIES TO IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS OR DEVELOP POLICY RECOMMENDATIONS TO REDUCE CANCER RISK AT THE POPULATION LEVEL.TO DATE, THE HANDBOOKS PROGRAMME HAS PRODUCED 19 VOLUMES, INCLUDING EVALUATIONS OF CHEMOPREVENTIVE AGENTS, BEHAVIOURAL INTERVENTIONS, CANCER SCREENING, AND POLICIES AND TAXATION. TO ACCOMPLISH ITS MISSION, THE PROGRAMME PERFORMS COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEMATIC REVIEWS OF THE AVAILABLE EVIDENCE ON THE EFFECTIVENESS OF PREVENTIVE INTERVENTIONS OR STRATEGIES IN REDUCING CANCER INCIDENCE OR MORTALITY. THE PROCESS ENGAGES INDEPENDENT, INTERDISCIPLINARY WORKING GROUPS OF INTERNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC EXPERTS WHO PERFORM A TRANSPARENT SYNTHESIS OF DIFFERENT STREAMS OF EVIDENCE, WHICH IS THEN TRANSLATED INTO AN OVERALL EVALUATION ACCORDING TO SET CRITERIA. THE PREAMBLES, ONE EACH FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION AND ONE FOR SECONDARY PREVENTION, DESCRIBE THE PROCEDURES THAT GUIDE THE EVALUATIONS. THE PREAMBLES, WHICH WERE THOROUGHLY REVIEWED AND REVISED IN 2019, CLEARLY DESCRIBE THE SYSTEMATIC REVIEW PROCESS IN 8 STEPS, AND DEFINE A NEW FRAMEWORK AND EVALUATION SCHEME FOR PRIMARY PREVENTION INTERVENTIONS AND A NEW EVALUATION SCHEME FOR SECONDARY PREVENTION INTERVENTIONS. THE INSTRUCTIONS TO AUTHORS HAVE BEEN UPDATED TO RESPOND TO THIS EVOLUTION OF THE STRUCTURE OF THE HANDBOOKS. DURING THE 5-YEAR PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE, WE WILL BUILD ON THE ACHIEVEMENTS OF THE CURRENT PERIOD WITH THE FOLLOWING AIMS: WE WILL ORGANIZE AT LEAST THREE HANDBOOKS MEETINGS TO EVALUATE INTERVENTIONS TARGETING CANCER-RELATED PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES OF HIGH CONCERN. THIS INVOLVES MONITORING THE LITERATURE TO IDENTIFY RELEVANT TOPICS; SELECTING A WORKING GROUP OF INTERNATIONAL EXPERTS; CONVENING THE WORKING GROUP AND COORDINATING THE SYSTEMATIC REVIEW AND CONSENSUS EVALUATION; PUBLISHING THE RESULTING EVALUATIONS AND THE FINAL HANDBOOK; AND DISSEMINATING THE OUTCOMES. WHEN THE TOPIC OF THE MEETING WARRANTS IT, WE WILL CONVENE A SCOPING MEETING AS A FIRST STEP IN THE PREPARATION, TO DEFINE THE OUTLINE, IDENTIFY POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS AND DETERMINE KEY AND CONTROVERSIAL ISSUES. THIS PREPARATORY STEP WILL ENHANCE THE FOCUS OF THE HANDBOOK AND BETTER TARGET USERS' NEEDS. WE WILL DEVELOP SUPPLEMENTARY PRODUCTS, BASED ON THE OUTCOMES OF THE MAIN HANDBOOK, THAT WILL HELP DECISION-MAKERS USE THE EVALUATIONS IN THEIR SPECIFIC SETTINGS. THE TYPES OF PRODUCTS WILL DEPEND ON THE INTERVENTION(S) EVALUATED, THE OUTCOME OF THE EVALUATIONS, AND SPECIFIC NEEDS RELATED TO THE INTERVENTIONS OR THE CANCER BURDEN. THEY MAY INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, COST-EFFECTIVENESS MODELLING STUDIES, MAPPING OF EVIDENCE GAPS, OR ANALYSES OF POPULATION-ATTRIBUTABLE FRACTIONS. WE WILL EXPAND OUR MEANS OF COMMUNICATION AND DISSEMINATION OF THE RESULTS TO A WIDER AUDIENCE, USING VARIOUS SOCIAL MEDIA CHANNELS AND PICTORIAL INFORMATION POSTED ON OUR WEBSITE. ALSO, THE PROGRAMME WILL STRENGTHEN EXCHANGES WITH OTHER IARC BRANCHES, WITH WHO, AND WITH OTHER NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS TO SHARE RESOURCES, OPTIMIZE EFFICIENCY, AND INCREASE THE VISIBILITY AND IMPACT OF THE PROGRAMME.

IMPROVING PATIENT OUTCOMES THROUGH INCREASED AWARENESS OF PSORIASIS AS A CHRONIC IMMUNE-MEDIATED SYSTEMIC INFLAMMATORY DISEASE - THE NATIONAL PSORIASIS FOUNDATION PROPOSES A THREE-YEAR PROJECT TO RAISE AWARENESS AMONG PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS, HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AND THE PUBLIC ABOUT PSORIASIS, AN IMMUNE-MEDIATED, SYSTEMIC, INFLAMMATORY DISEASE ASSOCIATED WITH CONSIDERABLE SOCIAL AND INDIVIDUAL BURDEN, AND INCREASED RATES OF COMORBIDITIES.  IT IS CRITICAL TO INCREASE EDUCATION AND AWARENESS ABOUT PSORIASIS IN ORDER TO EXPAND SCREENING, CARE AND APPROPRIATE INTERVENTIONS TO OPTIMIZE PATIENT OUTCOMES, ESPECIALLY FOR COMMUNITIES OF COLOR, THE LGBT COMMUNITY, RURAL COMMUNITIES, PEOPLE OF LOW SOCIOECONOMICS STATUS AND MEDICARE BENEFICIARIES.  TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL, NPF WILL:1.REVIEW AND SYNTHESIZE CURRENT DATA AND EVIDENCE ABOUT PSORIASIS TO INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONAL INDICATOR REPORT WHICH WILL BE DISSEMINATED TO PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS2.IDENTIFY DATA AND EVIDENCE GAPS ABOUT PSORIASIS AND DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THESE GAPS3.DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND ACTIVITIES TO RAISE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF PSORIASIS AS AN IMMUNE-MEDIATED SYSTEMIC INFLAMMATORY DISEASE AND THE ASSOCIATED COMORBID CONDITIONS4.DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND ACTIVITIES TO EDUCATE HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AND LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH OFFICES ABOUT PSORIASIS THAT ADDRESS ISSUES OF UNDIAGNOSED AND UNDERTREATED DISEASE, AND PRESENT EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS TO SCREEN AND/OR MANAGE COMORBIDITIES ASSOCIATED WITH PSORIASIS.

EXPANDING THE NATIONAL APPROACH TO HEARING LOSS EDUCATION AND AWARENESS - CDC'S NCCDPHP SEEKS TO SUPPORT EFFORTS TO IDENTIFY CHRONIC CONDITIONS NOT CURRENTLY SUPPORTED BY NCCDPHP'S BUDGET, FOR WHICH EFFORTS TO EXPAND THE SCIENTIFIC EVIDENCE BASE COULD LEAD TO MEANINGFUL IMPROVEMENTS IN PATIENT OUTCOMES. WE PROPOSE EXPANDING THE SCIENCE BASE FOR HEARING LOSS IN THE UNITED STATES ACROSS ALL AGE GROUPS. HEARING LOSS IS A HIGHLY PREVALENT CONDITION THAT REDUCES QUALITY OF LIFE AND IS A LEADING RISK FACTOR FOR DEPRESSION, DEMENTIA, INJURIES, AND ALL-CAUSE MORTALITY. PUBLIC HEALTH CAN IMPROVE PATIENT OUTCOMES AMONG PEOPLE WITH HEARING LOSS AS MULTIPLE INTERVENTIONS CAN PREVENT OR TREAT HEARING LOSS. CURRENTLY, NO STATE OR COUNTY LEVEL ESTIMATES EXIST TO GUIDE THE TARGETING OF PUBLIC HEALTH INTERVENTIONS. WE PROPOSE TO CREATE COMPOSITE ESTIMATES OF THE PREVALENCE OF HEARING LOSS AT THE U.S. COUNTY LEVEL BASED ON EXISTING HIGH-QUALITY DATA SOURCES. WE WILL HOUSE THESE ESTIMATES IN AN APPEALING AND EASY-TO-USE WEBSITE, INCLUDING SUMMARIZED BEST-PRACTICE AND PREVENTION RESOURCES ON THE SAME WEBSITE. FINALLY, WE WILL DISSEMINATE THE PROJECT'S INFORMATION TO HEARING LOSS PROFESSIONALS AND THE PUBLIC USING A COLLABORATIVE PARTNER ENGAGEMENT AND SOCIAL MEDIA APPROACH. OUR PROPOSAL BUILDS FROM THE EXPERIENCE OF NORC AND OUR PARTNERS ON PAST PROJECTS FOR NCCDPHP AND CDC, INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE VISION AND EYE HEALTH SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM (VEHSS) AND THE HOW RIGHT NOW COVID-19 HEALTH COMMUNICATIONS CAMPAIGN. OUR PROJECT TEAM INCLUDES;?EXPERTS IN HEARING LOSS MEASUREMENT AND EPIDEMIOLOGY; ?INVESTIGATORS WITH HIGHLY RELEVANT RECENT EXPERIENCE CREATING SURVEILLANCE INFORMATION;?EXPERTS IN HEALTH COMMUNICATIONS AND SOCIAL MEDIA OUTREACH; AND ?PARTNERSHIPS WITH LEADING HEARING LOSS NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THIS PROJECT CAN SIGNIFICANTLY EXPAND THE EVIDENCE BASE AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC HEALTH PRACTITIONERS AND THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING COUNTY-LEVEL ESTIMATES AND BEST PRACTICE INFORMATION ON AN EASILY ACCESSIBLE PUBLIC W EBSITE. IN ADDITION, OUR DISSEMINATION EFFORTS AND PARTNERSHIPS OFFER NCCDPHP A SUBSTANTIAL DEGREE OF CONFIDENCE THAT THE PROJECT'S INFORMATION WILL REACH ITS INTENDED AUDIENCES. IF SUCCESSFUL, THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE TARGETING OF PUBLIC HEALTH PRACTICE AT THE LOCAL LEVEL, INCREASE THE USE OF HEARING LOSS BEST PRACTICES, AND EXPAND AWARENESS ABOUT HEARING LOSS AMONG THE PUBLIC. EACH OF THESE OUTCOMES CAN IMPROVE PATIENT HEARING LOSS OUTCOMES, ENHANCING PUBLIC HEALTH IN THE UNITED STATES.

NATIONAL CAMPAIGN FOR LYMPHEDEMA AWARENESS - THE LYMPHATIC EDUCATION & RESEARCH NETWORK (LE&RN) IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENT A NATIONAL CAMPAIGN TO RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT LYMPHEDEMA AMONG THE PUBLIC AND HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS (HCPS). UP TO 10 MILLION INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES LIVE WITH LYMPHEDEMA (LE) [1] WHICH REQUIRES ONGOING THERAPIES THAT ENTAIL CHRONIC PHYSICAL INTERVENTIONS AND MAY INCLUDE SURGERY, DRASTICALLY AND NEGATIVELY IMPACTS A PATIENT?S QUALITY OF LIFE. THE EXTRAORDINARY COST TO THE US HEALTHCARE SYSTEM IS BASED UPON AN ESTIMATED AGGREGATE COST /PATIENT-YEAR OF MORE THAN $62,000 [3]. DISTURBINGLY, OVER 80% CANCER-RELATED LE PATIENTS MAY BE UNINFORMED OR TRAINED ABOUT THE DEVELOPMENT OF LYMPHEDEMA FOLLOWING SURGERY. [25]THIS PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE 20 YEARS OF EXPERIENCING EDUCATING AND TRAINING PATIENTS AND HCPS ABOUT LYMPHEDEMA, AS WELL AS A VAST NETWORK OF INSTITUTIONAL PARTNERS INCLUDING MEDICAL ASSOCIATIONS (AMERICAN SOCIETY OF BREAST SURGEONS, AMERICAN VENOUS FORUM, AMERICAN VEIN & LYMPHATIC SOCIETY), RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS (STANFORD UNIVERSITY MEDICAL SCHOOL, HARVARD MEDICAL SCHOOL, AND OTHERS), AND OVER 30 CENTERS OF EXCELLENCE IN THE DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT OF LYMPHATIC DISEASES (?COES,? WHICH ARE PART OF A NETWORK FORMED BY LE&RN). BEYOND THE TEAM/ PARTNERSHIP?S EXPERIENCE IN THE RESEARCH AND TRAINING AROUND THIS CHRONIC DISEASE, LE&RN HAS EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE DESIGNING AND EXECUTING AWARENESS CAMPAIGNS THAT ARE NATIONAL IN SCOPE.THIS PROJECT WILL INVOLVE TWO KEY PHASES, WITH ALL ACTIVITIES ALIGNED WITH AND DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE THE PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES OUTLINED BY THE CDC. PHASE I ? IN PARTNERSHIP WITH STANFORD UNIVERSITY, LE&RN WILL SYNTHESIZE AND COMPILE DISEASE INDICATORS AND INFORMATION ABOUT BEST/ EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICES FOR THE PREVENTION, DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT OF LE. THIS INFORMATION WILL BE DISSEMINATED TO PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS. ALSO IN THIS PHASE, CANCER PATIENTS AND HCPS WILL BE SURVEYED SO THAT GAPS IN KNOWLEDGE MAY BE PINPOINTED, AND USED AS THE BASIS FOR MATERIALS (PHASE II) TO BE DISSEMINATED TO THESE SAME GROUPS. PHASE II ? IN COLLABORATION WITH A MEDIA/ PROMOTION COMPANY (CITIZEN GROUP), WITH WHICH LE&RN HAS SUCCESSFULLY COLLABORATED IN PAST/ SIMILAR EFFORTS, A COMPREHENSIVE AWARENESS CAMPAIGN WILL BE DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED. THE CAMPAIGN WILL CONSIST, PRIMARILY, OF PROMOTING LE&RN?S EXISTING AND NEWLY DEVELOPED (DURING PROJECT) EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS THROUGH SOCIAL NETWORKS AND PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS (VIDEO ADS PLAYED AT NO-COST TO THE PROJECT ON NETWORKS/ SYNDICATES ACROSS THE COUNTRY). THE PRIMARY DEMOGRAPHIC WITHIN THE PUBLIC AUDIENCE, TO BE TARGETED WITH AWARENESS INFORMATION, ARE INDIVIDUALS WITH CANCER (WHO ARE AT THE HIGHEST RISK OF DEVELOPING LE) WHO HAVE NOT YET HAD SURGICAL INTERVENTION. ADDITIONAL AWARENESS ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PRESENTATIONS AT EVENTS AND ON NATIONALLY-TELEVISED TELEVISION PROGRAMMING THROUGH LE&RN?S CELEBRITY ?AMBASSADORS.? LE&RN?S EXTENSIVE NETWORK OF MEDIAL ASSOCIATION PARTNERS AS WELL AS THE COES WILL FURTHER ASSIST IN THE DISSEMINATION OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO BOTH PATIENTS AND HCPS. THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT, THE PI WILL MONITOR PROGRESS AND AVAILABLE METRICS (AVAILABLE THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA/ AD PLATFORMS) AND ADJUST CAMPAIGN ACTIVITIES ACCORDINGLY.THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO REACH OVER 20 MILLION INDIVIDUALS WITH AT LEAST ONE CAMPAIGN MESSAGE, AND RESULT IN PSA-ADS WITH AN ESTIMATED VALUE OF BETWEEN $4.5 - $5.5 MILLION.

OBSTRUCTIVE SLEEP APNEA (OSA) AWARENESS PROJECT - PURPOSE? INCREASING AWARENESS OF PUBLIC HEALTH DATA RELATED TO OSA WILL SPUR PUBLIC HEALTH STAKEHOLDERS TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE WITH POPULATIONS AFFECTED BY THIS DISORDER.?THIS WILL SUPPORT THE SLEEP HEALTH GOALS OF HEALTHY PEOPLE 2030 BY ?INCREASING THE PROPORTION OF ADULTS WITH SLEEP APNEA SYMPTOMS WHO GET EVALUATED BY A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER.??THE DRIVING FORCE BEHIND THE PROGRAM WILL BE THE FORMATION OF A COALITION OF PARTNERS AND COLLABORATORS THAT WILL WORK TOGETHER IN AN ACTIVE ALLIANCE TO MAKE A SIGNIFICANT, WIDESPREAD AND MEASURABLE IMPACT ON PUBLIC AND PROFESSIONAL AWARENESS OF OSA THAT ULTIMATELY RESULTS IN POSITIVE BEHAVIOR CHANGE. OUTCOMES? OUTCOME 1: INCREASED AWARENESS OF OSA PUBLIC HEALTH DATA AMONG PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AND NON-SLEEP HEALTH PROFESSIONALS? OUTCOME 2: INCREASED DEVELOPMENT AND DISSEMINATION OF EVIDENCE-BASED PUBLIC HEALTH STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS?OSA? OUTCOME 3: INCREASED AWARENESS OF OSA, TESTING OPTIONS, REFERRAL OPTIONS, AND TREATMENT/MANAGEMENT OPTIONS AMONG PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AND NON-SLEEP HEALTH PROFESSIONALS? OUTCOME 4: INCREASED AWARENESS OF OSA, TESTING PROCEDURES, AND EVIDENCE-BASED TREATMENT/MANAGEMENT OPTIONS IN THE GENERAL PUBLIC,?INCLUDING SPECIFIC POPULATIONS AFFECTED BY HEALTH DISPARITIES IN RELATION TO?OSA? OUTCOM E 5: INCREASED USE OF SLEEP APNEA SCREENING TOOLS/QUESTIONS?BY NON-SLEEP HEALTH PROFESSIONALS?

ADVANCING ARTHRITIS PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACHES THROUGH NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS - THE NATIONAL RECREATION AND PARK ASSOCIATION (NRPA) RESPECTFULLY SUBMITS THIS PROPOSAL TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH, WELLNESS, AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF THOSE WITH ARTHRITIS BY EXPANDING AND SUSTAINING THE EQUITABLE DISSEMINATION AND DELIVERY OF ARTHRITIS-APPROPRIATE, EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS (AAEBIS) THROUGH LOCAL PARKS AND RECREATION (P&R). THROUGH THE PROPOSED STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES, NRPA AIMS TO INCREASE THE AVAILABILITY, PARTICIPATION, AND SUSTAINABLE SUPPORTS FOR AAEBIS THAT IMPROVE ARTHRITIS MANAGEMENT AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR A PORTION OF THE MORE THAN 55 MILLION ADULTS CURRENTLY LIVING WITH ARTHRITIS?. THROUGH THIS APPROACH, NRPA WILL LEVERAGE OUR NATIONAL NETWORK OF LOCAL P&R AGENCIES AND PROFESSIONALS TO BUILD UPON A STRONG FOUNDATION THAT PRIORITIZES ACCESS TO EVIDENCE-BASED PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND CHRONIC DISEASE MANAGEMENT INTERVENTIONS IN COMMUNITY-BASED SETTINGS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADVANCE ARTHRITIS PUBLIC HEALTH PRIORITIES TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS BY CONTINUING TO EXPAND THE DISSEMINATION AND DELIVERY OF AAEBIS THROUGH A NATIONAL NETWORK OF LOCAL P&R AGENCIES, REACHING 50,000 ADULTS IN AT LEAST 25 STATES OVER THE FIVE-YEAR PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE. NRPA WILL IMPLEMENT A TIERED EQUITABLE GRANTMAKING AND TA APPROACH THAT PROVIDES A COMBINATION OF AAEBI INSTRUCTOR TRAININGS AND EQUIPMENT, FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO ELIGIBLE P&R AGENCIES BASED ON THE COMMUNITY?S RISK AND NEED AS DETERMINED BY CDC?S SOCIAL VULNERABILITY INDEX (SVI), AND IN-DEPTH TRAINING AND TA DELIVERED THROUGH AN 18-MONTH LONG COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE (COP). THE COP WILL FOCUS ON EMBEDDING A SYSTEMS-CHANGE APPROACH THAT CENTERS HEALTH EQUITY AND ENSURES THAT PEOPLE MOST IMPACTED BY ARTHRITIS AND ARTHRITIS COMORBIDITIES CAN ACCESS AND PARTICIPATE IN AAEBIS, WHILE SUPPORTING P&R AGENCIES TO EXPAND AND SUSTAIN EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMMING THROUGH PARTNERSHIP BUILDING, RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION EFFORTS, LEADERSHIP BUY-IN, POLICY CHANGE, AND ESTABLISHING REFERRAL SYSTEMS. THE OVERALL INTENDED OUTCOMES FOR THE FIVE-YEAR PERIOD ARE: LONG-TERM?IMPROVED ARTHRITIS MANAGEMENT BEHAVIORS INCLUDING DECREASED PHYSICAL INACTIVITY AMONG ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS ?IMPROVED SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENTS AND OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS RESULTING IN REDUCED PAIN, IMPROVED FUNCTION, AND LIMITED ARTHRITIS PROGRESSIONMEDIUM-TERM?INCREASED NUMBER OF ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS WHO PARTICIPATE IN AAEBIS?REDUCED DISPARITIES IN ACCESS TO INTERVENTIONS AND SERVICES?INCREASED NUMBER OF PRIORITIES ADDRESSED AS IDENTIFIED IN A NATIONAL PUBLIC HEALTH AGENDA FOR OSTEOARTHRITIS: 2020 UPDATESHORT-TERM?INCREASED NUMBER OF AAEBI COURSES OFFERED, PARTICULARLY IN STATES WITH HIGH RATES OF ARTHRITIS, NOT CURRENTLY RECEIVING CDC ARTHRITIS FUNDING, AND UNDER-RESOURCED COMMUNITIES ?INCREASED NUMBER OF AAEBI INSTRUCTORS TRAINED TO DELIVER PROGRAMS IN P&R AGENCIES?INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF WHY AND HOW TO CENTER HEALTH EQUITY IN AAEBI IMPLEMENTATION AND SUSTAIN PROGRAMS TO ENSURE ALL COMMUNITY MEMBERS BENEFIT

ADVANCING ARTHRITIS PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACHES THROUGH NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS - OVER A FIVE-YEAR PERIOD, YMCA OF THE USA (Y-USA) WILL CARRY OUT AN AAEBI ACCESS AND ENGAGEMENT PROJECT WITH MEMBER YMCA ASSOCIATIONS (I.E., LOCAL YS) TO REACH A MINIMUM OF 50,000 ADULTS PARTICIPATING IN AAEBIS ACROSS THE COUNTRY WITH SPECIFIC EMPHASIS ON REACHING 25 STATES NOT RECEIVING CDC ARTHRITIS FUNDING.PURPOSE. THROUGH THE YMCA AAEBI ACCESS AND ENGAGEMENT PROJECT, Y-USA WILL IMPROVE ACCESS AND ENGAGEMENT OF ADULTS LIVING WITH ARTHRITIS TO AAEBIS THROUGH INCREASED REACH OF BOTH IN-PERSON AND ONLINE INTERVENTIONS. AAEBIS TO BE DELIVERED WILL INCLUDE: ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION AQUATIC PROGRAM, ACTIVE LIVING EVERYDAY, ENHANCE?FITNESS, FIT & STRONG!, WALK WITH EASE/ GROUP, AS WELL AS THE PROMISING PROGRAMS OF ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION EXERCISE PROGRAM AND WALK WITH EASE/SELF-DIRECTED. COLLECTIVELY, THIS MENU OF INTERVENTIONS WILL PROVIDE THE GREATEST NUMBER OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS TO TAKE PART IN AAEBIS THROUGH LOCAL YS ? HELPING TO REDUCE HEALTH DISPARITIES, IMPROVE ARTHRITIS MANAGEMENT AND HEALTH OUTCOMES, AS WELL AS ENHANCE HEALTH, WELLNESS, AND QUALITY OF LIFE.THE OUTCOMES TO BE MEASURED THROUGH THE YMCA AAEBI ACCESS AND ENGAGEMENT PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE LONG-TERM CDC GOALS OF INCREASING THE NUMBER OF AAEBI COURSES OFFERED ? PARTICULARLY IN STATES NOT RECEIVING CDC ARTHRITIS FUNDING AND IN COMMUNITIES DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED BY HEALTH DISPARITIES. IT WILL ALSO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS WHO PARTICIPATE IN AAEBIS, IMPROVE ACCESS TO AAEBIS, ENHANCE ARTHRITIS MANAGEMENT BEHAVIOR, AS WELL AS STRENGTHEN SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENTS FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS. SPECIFIC OUTCOMES ARE AS FOLLOW:OUTCOME MEASURE 1: TO IMPROVE ARTHRITIS MANAGEMENT BEHAVIOR AMONG ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS, Y-USA WILL: A) EXPLORE, IDENTIFY, AND IMPLEMENT BEST PRACTICES THAT INCREASE THE REACH AND RETENTION OF ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS IN CDC-RECOMMENDED AAEBIS; B) EXPAND THE NUMBER OF NEW LOCAL YS AND NUMBER OF AAEBI COURSES DELIVERE D TO ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS IN SOCIALLY VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES ? PARTICULARLY IN COMMUNITIES OF COLOR, AND COMMUNITIES WITHOUT ACCESS TO ARTHRITIS PROGRAMMING ? AND IN STATES THAT ARE NOT CURRENTLY RECEIVING CDC ARTHRITIS FUNDING; C) INCREASE ENGAGEMENT OF LOCAL YS ALREADY DELIVERING AAEBIS BY EXPANDING THEIR MENU OF AAEBI OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO ADULTS, ESTABLISHING AND STRENGTHENING CLINICAL LINKAGES, AND/OR DETERMINE SUSTAINABLE MODELS OF ON-GOING PROGRAM DELIVERY TO REACH MORE COMMUNITIES, POPULATIONS, AND ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS; AND D) ENHANCE DELIVERY OF AAEBIS BY ESTABLISHING WRAPAROUND SUPPORTS FOR PARTICIPANTS THAT LEVERAGE CONNECTIONS TO ADDITIONAL Y SERVICES AND THOSE OFFERED BY OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS.OUTCOME MEASURE 2: TO IMPROVE SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENTS FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS, Y-USA WILL: A) STRENGTHEN Y CAPACITY TO ADDRESS THE EFFECTS OF THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH, LEADING TO GREATER ACCESS TO AAEBI SERVICES FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS; B) BUILD AND IMPLEMENT STRUCTURED SUPPORTS FOR REMOTE DELIVERY (VIRTUAL) OF AAEBIS, LEADING TO GREATER ACCESS FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS WHO ARE UNWILLING, UNABLE, OR OTHERWISE NOT CAPABLE OF MEETING IN-PERSON; C) ASSESS/IMPROVE SAFETY AND ACCESSIBILITY OF THE PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT BY EXPANDING THE GEOGRAPHIC REACH OF AAEBIS INTO SOCIALLY VULNERABLE AND DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED COMMUNITIES AS WELL AS INCREASING AVAILABILITY OF AAEBI SERVICES TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO HAVE NOT BEEN HISTORICALLY REFLECTED IN PROGRAM POPULATIONS; AND D) DEVELOP NEW MARKETING TOOLS, STORYBOOKS, AND MATERIALS THAT PROMOTE SOCIAL CONNECTEDNESS BENEFIT OF PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AND PROMOTE ACCESS TO PHYSICAL ACTIVITY OPPORTUNITIES.

ADVANCING ARTHRITIS PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACHES THROUGH NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS - THE ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION IS THE LARGEST VOLUNTARY HEALTH ORGANIZATION WITH A MISSION TO CONQUER ARTHRITIS. WE HAVE OVER 70 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE, ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AND INNOVATIONS THAT HAVE IMPROVED THE LIVES OF PEOPLE IMPACTED BY ARTHRITIS THROUGHS SUPPORT, SCIENCE, AND ADVOCACY. WE ARE CONFIDENT THAT WE HAVE THE EXPERTISE, ABILITY, AND CAPACITY TO DELIVER ON THE CDC?S STATED OUTCOMES FOR COMPONENT 1, STRATEGY B AS DESCRIBED IN THE FUNDING OPPORTUNITY ANNOUNCEMENT BY EXPANDING THE NATIONAL PROVISION OF CONSUMER ARTHRITIS INFORMATION AND INTERVENTION REFERRAL SERVICES. FUNDING FROM THE CDC WILL SUPPORT OUR HELPLINE FOR PEOPLE IMPACTED BY ARTHRITIS (HELPLINE) PROGRAM. OUR PRIMARY GOAL IS DELIVERING TIMELY, PERSONALIZED, AND IMPACTFUL INFORMATION TO CONSUMERS THAT PRESENT THEM WITH ACTIONABLE ITEMS FROM WHICH THEY CAN CHOOSE. FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT OUR LONG-TERM OUTCOMES FOR THE PROGRAM: OUTCOME #1: WE WILL INCREASE CONFIDENCE IN OUR PROGRAM AND ENCOURAGE REPEATED UTILIZATION OF IT BY ENSURING THAT 100% OF CONSUMERS RECEIVE A RESPONSE FROM OUR HELPLINE WITHIN TWO BUSINESS DAYS OF CONTACT THROUGHOUT THE GRANT PERIOD. OUTCOME #2: THROUGH INCREASED USAGE OF OUR HELPLINE PROGRAM, THERE WILL BE A 10% INCREASE IN REFERRALS TO AAEBI OFFERINGS, INCLUDING OUR OWN WALK WITH EASE PROGRAM, OVER THE PREVIOUS GRANT PERIOD. OUTCOME #3: AS A RESULT OF OUR IMPROVEMENT PROCESS FOCUSED ON RESPONSE AND QUALITY, AT LEAST 85% OF CONSUMERS WHO COMPLETE A FOLLOW-UP SURVEY WILL REPORT BEING SATISFIED BY THEIR HELPLINE EXPERIENCE THROUGHOUT THE GRANT PERIOD. THE FOCUS OF OUR PROPOSED PROGRAM IS OUR HELPLINE, ESTABLISHED WITH CDC FUNDING AND LAUNCHED APRIL 2016. OUR TOLL-FREE HELPLINE WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC 24 HOURS A DAY, 365 DAYS A YEAR VIA TELEPHONE OR EMAIL. THE HELPLINE WILL BE STAFFED BY THREE FULL-TIME HELPLINE SPECIALISTS AND ONE FULL-TIME HELPLINE DIRECTOR. ALL HELPLINE SPECIALISTS POSSESS YEARS OF PRIOR EXPERIENCE IN PUBLIC HEALTH ? PARTICULARLY ARTHRITIS  ? SECTORS AND ASSISTING PEOPLE WITH CASE MANAGEMENT, REFERRAL COORDINATION, AND RESOURCE RESEARCH. OUR HELPLINE DIRECTOR HAS OVER A DECADE OF EXPERIENCE IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD FOCUSING ON QUALITY IMPROVEMENT, TEAM LEADERSHIP, DATA INTEGRITY, TRAINING, AND CONSUMER EXPERIENCE.   OUR PROPOSAL SEEKS TO BUILD ON THE SUCCESS AND DEMONSTRATED NEED FOR OUR HELPLINE PROGRAM TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE RESOURCE, INTEGRATE LANGUAGE TRANSLATION SERVICES TO INCREASE ACCESSIBILITY, AND GROW OUR INTERNAL RESOURCE LIBRARY TO PROVIDE THE BEST INFORMATION POSSIBLE TO OUR CONSUMERS.

ADVANCING ARTHRITIS PUBLIC HEALTH PRIORITIES THROUGH NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS - COMPONENT 2 - ARTHRITIS HAS A PROFOUND ECONOMIC, PERSONAL, AND SOCIETAL IMPACT IN THE UNITED STATES. MORE THAN 54 MILLION US ADULTS HAVE ARTHRITIS, HALF OF WHOM ARE WORKING AGED, AND 78 MILLION ARE PROJECTED TO HAVE IT BY 2040. ARTHRITIS IS A LEADING CONTRIBUTOR TO CHRONIC DISEASE BURDEN AND A TOP CAUSE OF MORBIDITY, WORK LIMITATIONS, AND REDUCED QUALITY OF LIFE. SIMILARLY, ARTHRITIS CO-OCCURS WITH OTHER CHRONIC CONDITIONS SUCH AS HEART DISEASE, DIABETES, AND OBESITY. FORTUNATELY, ARTHRITIS AND ITS LIMITATIONS CAN BE MANAGED EFFECTIVELY THROUGH ROUTINE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND PARTICIPATION IN SELF-MANAGEMENT EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CHRONIC DISEASE DIRECTORS (NACDD) IS PROPOSING TO LEVERAGE 20 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE WITH THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION?S ARTHRITIS PROGRAM TO BUILD ON SUCCESSES AND LESSONS LEARNED WITHIN THE ARTHRITIS PORTFOLIO OF PROJECTS, WHILE ALSO ENGAGING KEY NATIONAL-LEVEL ORGANIZATIONS THAT ENHANCE REACH AND EXTEND PARTNERSHIPS. NACDD LINKS MORE THAN 7,000 DIVERSE, MULTI-DISCIPLINARY MEMBERS, INCLUDING PHYSICIANS, NURSES, HEALTH EDUCATORS, SOCIAL WORKERS, DIETITIANS, EPIDEMIOLOGISTS, PROGRAM PLANNERS AND EVALUATORS, PROGRAM MANAGERS AND ADMINISTRATORS, AND HEALTH INTELLIGENCE AND POLICY EXPERTS, IN A NETWORK TO PROMOTE NATIONAL PRIORITIES, AND PREVENTION POLICIES AND PROGRAMS; ENCOURAGE KNOWLEDGE SHARING; AND DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS FOR PROMOTING HEALTH. NACDD?S STRATEGIC MAP GUIDES THE WORK OF THE ASSOCIATION AS IT AIMS TO LEAD AND SUPPORT STATES IN PREVENTING CHRONIC DISEASE THROUGH HEALTHY COMMUNITIES, EQUITABLE OPPORTUNITIES, AND A MODERNIZED HEALTH SYSTEM. THIS PROPOSED PROJECT BEGINS WITH SYNTHESIZING INFORMATION FROM PAST PROJECTS TO HELP DIRECT PRIMARY AND SECONDARY RESEARCH, AND ENGAGING HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AND ALLIED HEALTH PROFESSIONALS IN A CLINICAL PRACTICE ASSESSMENT TO COLLECT INFORMATION WHILE ALSO PROVIDING TRAINING AND EDUCATION. INFORMATION GLEANED WILL BE USED TO GUIDE A NATIONAL PANEL OF EXPERTS AS THEY INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN APPROACH DESIGNED TO SUPPORT HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS IN DELIVERING CLINICAL SERVICES TO PEOPLE WITH ARTHRITIS. THE APPROACH WILL BE PILOTED IN A LARGE HEALTH SYSTEM THAT SERVES A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF MEDICARE/MEDICAID ELIGIBLE CLIENTS/PATIENTS AND REFINED BASED ON PILOT DATA AND PROJECT EVALUATION. THE REVISED APPROACH FRAMEWORK WILL BE DISSEMINATED BROADLY THROUGH CME/CE OPPORTUNITIES AND BY WORKING WITH PARTNERS CONNECTED TO PHYSICIANS AND ALLIED HEALTH PROFESSIONALS WORLDWIDE. THE FINAL PROJECT YEAR WILL CONCLUDE WITH A HARVEST MEETING OF PROJECT PARTNERS WHERE LESSONS LEARNED, SUCCESSES ACHIEVED, AND CHALLENGES OVERCOME WILL BE SHOWCASED. A PLAN FOR FUTURE APPROACHES WILL ALSO BE A FOCUS OF THE HARVEST MEETING.THIS PROPOSAL DETAILS THE APPROACH OF NACDD, LEAVITT PARTNERS, AND KEY NATIONAL COLLEAGUES TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT AN EVIDENCE-INFORMED APPROACH TO SUPPORT HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS IN DELIVERING CLINICAL SERVICES TO PEOPLE WITH ARTHRITIS, WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING THE OUTCOMES OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. THE WORK OF NACDD AND NATIONAL PARTNERS WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED ARTHRITIS MANAGEMENT BEHAVIORS AMONG ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS; DECREASED PHYSICAL INACTIVITY AMONG ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS; IMPROVED SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENTS FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS; AND REDUCED PAIN, IMPROVED FUNCTION, AND LIMITED ARTHRITIS PROGRESSION.5 YEAR PROJECT REACH: 600,000 HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS

ADVANCING ARTHRITIS PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACHES THROUGH NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS - OSTEOARTHRITIS (OA) IS A LEADING CAUSE OF DISABILITY AND WORK LIMITATIONS AMONG ADULTS IN THE UNITED STATES (US). BY 2030, THE PREVALENCE OF OA IS EXPECTED TO SOAR TO 67 MILLION ADULTS (25% OF ALL US ADULTS). DURING 2008-2011, TOTAL MEDICAL EXPENDITURES FOR OA AVERAGED $340 BILLION ANNUALLY IN THE US. AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE OVERWHELMING COSTS ON INDIVIDUALS, OUR HEALTHCARE SYSTEM, AND SOCIETY, CONFRONTING THIS INCREASINGLY PREVALENT DISEASE AT THE PUBLIC HEALTH LEVEL IS IMPERATIVE.THE OSTEOARTHRITIS ACTION ALLIANCE (OAAA), A COALITION OF CONCERNED ORGANIZATIONS COMMITTED TO DIMINISHING THE ENORMOUS BURDEN OF OA, IS UNIQUELY POSITIONED AS A LEADER OF THIS PUBLIC HEALTH EFFORT. THE OAAA WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2011 TO ADVANCE A NATIONAL PUBLIC HEALTH AGENDA FOR OSTEOARTHRITIS (OA AGENDA), A PUBLICATION DEVELOPED IN 2010 BY THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) AND THE ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION (AF). SINCE THE TRANSFER OF OAAA ACTIVITIES FROM THE AF TO THE THURSTON ARTHRITIS RESEARCH CENTER (TARC) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA-CHAPEL HILL (UNC) IN 2014, THE COALITION HAS GROWN SUBSTANTIALLY FROM 30 TO 135 MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS, AND REMARKABLE PROGRESS HAS BEEN MADE IN ADVANCING KEY COMPONENTS OF THE OA AGENDA. IN 2019, THE OAAA LED EFFORTS WITH THE CDC AND AF TO UPDATE THE OA AGENDA FOR 2020. BY LEVERAGING PARTNERSHIPS, COLLABORATIONS, RESOURCES, AND CURRENT PROGRAMMATIC ENDEAVORS OF OAAA MEMBERS, THE OAAA, WITH FURTHER FUNDING SUPPORT, WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE INNOVATIVE AND ENDURING ACTIONS AND WILL AMPLIFY EFFORTS TO FACILITATE COLLABORATIVE PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION TO SUCCESSFULLY REDUCE THE SIGNIFICANT BURDEN OF OA AND OTHER TYPES OF ARTHRITIS. IN RESPONSE TO COMPONENT 1, STRATEGY C, THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH TWO OVERARCHING GOALS:GOAL 1: MAINTAIN AND FACILITATE AN ACTIVE NATIONAL ALLIANCE OF ORGANIZATIONS COMMITTED TO ADDRESSING OA FROM A PUBLIC HEALTH PERSPECTIVE AS OUTLINED IN THE GOALS AND STRATEGIES OUTLINED IN A NATIONAL PU BLIC HEALTH AGENDA FOR OSTEOARTHRITIS: 2020 UPDATE (OA AGENDA). OAAA IS PROUD TO HAVE SPEARHEADED THE OA AGENDA 2020 UPDATE AND WILL MOVE THIS WORK FORWARD TO LEVERAGE PARTNERS, STAKEHOLDERS, DATA, POLICY, AND COMMUNICATION ASSETS AND OTHER CHRONIC DISEASE RESOURCES AND INITIATIVES TO ADDRESS OA AGENDA GOALS AND STRATEGIES. FURTHER, THE OAAA WILL EXPAND ITS PORTFOLIO OF FUNDING AND LEVERAGED SUPPORT TOWARD INCREASED SUSTAINABILITY, AND UNDERTAKE STRUCTURED EVALUATION TO ENSURE IT IS STEWARDING ALL FUNDING TO ACHIEVE STATED GOALS. GOAL 2: FOSTER COLLABORATIVE AND COORDINATED PUBLIC HEALTH ACTION TO INCREASE SUPPORT AND RESOURCES FOR ADDRESSING OA AGENDA PRIORITIES AND STRATEGIES. THE OAAA ENGAGES NUMEROUS PRIORITY AUDIENCES, WITH PARTICULAR FOCUS ON HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AND OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS. THE OAAA WILL EXPAND THE MENU OF RECOGNIZED OPTIONS FOR EVIDENCE-BASED, PACKAGED, SELF-MANAGEMENT EDUCATION AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY PROGRAMS, AND PROMOTE THE WIDESPREAD ADOPTION AND USE OF EVIDENCE-BASED TOOLS FOR OA MANAGEMENT. FINALLY, THE OAAA WILL CREATE AND MAINTAIN A NATIONAL OA RESOURCE CENTER FOR HOUSING EVIDENCE-BASED TOOLS AND MATERIALS.

ADVANCING ARTHRITIS PUBLIC HEALTH APPROACHES THROUGH NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS - ARTHRITIS HAS A PROFOUND ECONOMIC, PERSONAL, AND SOCIETAL IMPACT IN THE UNITED STATES. MORE THAN 54 MILLION US ADULTS HAVE ARTHRITIS, HALF OF WHOM ARE WORKING AGED, AND 78 MILLION ARE PROJECTED TO HAVE IT BY 2040. ARTHRITIS IS A LEADING CONTRIBUTOR TO CHRONIC DISEASE BURDEN AND A TOP CAUSE OF MORBIDITY, WORK LIMITATIONS, AND REDUCED QUALITY OF LIFE. SIMILARLY, ARTHRITIS CO-OCCURS WITH OTHER CHRONIC CONDITIONS SUCH AS HEART DISEASE, DIABETES, AND OBESITY. FORTUNATELY, ARTHRITIS AND ITS LIMITATIONS CAN BE MANAGED EFFECTIVELY THROUGH ROUTINE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND PARTICIPATION IN SELF-MANAGEMENT EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CHRONIC DISEASE DIRECTORS (NACDD) IS A CAPACITY BUILDING ORGANIZATION THAT WORKS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF THE PUBLIC BY STRENGTHENING THE STATE-BASED LEADERSHIP AND EXPERTISE FOR CHRONIC DISEASE PREVENTION AND CONTROL IN STATES AND AT THE NATIONAL LEVEL. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO UTILIZE NACDD?S THIRTY YEARS OF EXPERIENCE TO INCREASE STATE CAPACITY TO ADDRESS AND IMPLEMENT ARTHRITIS-APPROPRIATE EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS (AAEBI) BY PROVIDING FORMAL AND INFORMAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, NETWORKING, AND INFORMATION SHARING BETWEEN CDC-FUNDED ARTHRITIS STATES, UNFUNDED STATES, AND OTHER PARTNERS AND INFLUENCERS. NACDD PROPOSES TO LEVERAGE PARTNERS AND NETWORKS TO PROMOTE AAEBIS AND TO EMBED THEM INTO OTHER PROGRAMS AND EFFORTS AS THE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY COMPONENT. ADDITIONALLY, NACDD PLANS TO INCORPORATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ROUTINE PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND PARTICIPATION IN SELF-MANAGEMENT EDUCATION PROGRAMS INTO STATE AND PARTNER PLANS TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF AND PARTICIPATION IN AAEBIS, INCREASE REACH AND VISIBILITY OF PROGRAMMING TO THOSE WHO NEED THEM MOST, AND SUPPORT OVERALL SUSTAINABILITY EFFORTS. NACDD WILL FOSTER PEER-TO-PEER COLLABORATION BY SHARING BEST PRACTICES, RESOURCES, AND TOOLS IN ADDITION TO DOCUMENTING LESSONS LEARNED AND SUCCESS STORIES. THIS WORK WILL COLLECTIVELY IMPROVE ARTH RITIS SELF-MANAGEMENT BEHAVIORS AMONG ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS WHILE IMPROVING SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENTS FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS AS WELL. OVER THE COURSE OF THE FIVE-YEAR AGREEMENT, NACDD WILL INCREASE PEER-TO-PEER LEARNING AND SHARING, STATE CAPACITY, ADOPTION OF STATE-LEVEL POLICIES AND PLANS, AND THE NUMBER OF EFFECTIVE STRATEGIES IMPLEMENTED BY STATES TO ADDRESS AND REDUCE THE BURDEN OF ARTHRITIS. THIS PROPOSAL DETAILS NACDD?S APPROACH TO PROVISION OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE PARTNERS AND THE PROPOSED STRATEGIES, ACTIVITIES, AND EVALUATION EFFORTS THAT WILL HELP MEET THE OUTCOMES OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. NACDD WILL LEVERAGE TWENTY YEARS OF EXPERIENCE WITH THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION?S ARTHRITIS PROGRAM TO DEMONSTRATE NACDD?S CAPACITY TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO EXPAND STATE CAPACITY; FACILITATE COMMUNITY-CLINICAL COLLABORATIONS; CONVENE PARTNERS; AND PROMOTE AND SHARE BEST PRACTICES TO IMPROVE HEALTH, WELLNESS, AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ADULTS WITH ARTHRITIS.

STRENGTHENING BREASTFEEDING SUPPORT BY COORDINATION NATIONAL EFFORTS AND BUILDING CAPACITY OF BREASTFEEDING COALITIONS - HUMAN MILK FEEDING (INCLUSIVE OF BREAST, CHEST, AND BODY FEEDING) IS A PROVEN PRIMARY PREVENTION STRATEGY THAT BUILDS A FOUNDATION FOR LIFE-LONG HEALTH AND WELLNESS. AS STATED IN THE SURGEON GENERAL?S CALL TO ACTION TO SUPPORT BREASTFEEDING, THE U.S. BREASTFEEDING COMMITTEE (USBC) AND ITS AFFILIATED BREASTFEEDING COALITIONS ARE THE BACKBONE OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE IN SUPPORT OF NATIONWIDE BREASTFEEDING GOALS. THE CALL TO ACTION EXPLICITLY STATES THAT ?THE CAPACITY OF STATE BREASTFEEDING COALITIONS SHOULD BE ENHANCED TO ENABLE THEM TO BE AN EFFECTIVE FORCE IN PROMOTING AND SUPPORTING BREASTFEEDING.? FOR OVER 20 YEARS, USBC HAS SERVED AS A DRIVING FORCE TO ADVANCE BOTH POLICY AND PRACTICE THAT PROMOTES, PROTECTS, AND SUPPORTS BREASTFEEDING. USBC IS OPTIMALLY POSITIONED TO COORDINATE A NATIONAL APPROACH TO STRENGTHEN THE LANDSCAPE OF LACTATION SUPPORT, CENTERED ON RACIAL EQUITY, FOR THE FIRST FOOD FIELD. IT HAS SERVED FOR DECADES AS THE CENTRAL HUB AND BACKBONE ORGANIZATION PROVIDING INFRASTRUCTURE SUPPORT TO CONNECT NON-PROFIT, FOR-PROFIT, AND GOVERNMENTAL BREASTFEEDING SUPPORT PARTNERS TO FACILITATE MEANINGFUL ENGAGEMENT OF ALL STAKEHOLDERS AT EVERY LEVEL OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM.USBC HAS ALSO MAINTAINED A SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD OF PROVIDING CAPACITY-BUILDING SUPPORT TO STATE/TERRITORIAL BREASTFEEDING COALITIONS THROUGH ITS VIRTUAL, YEAR-ROUND LEARNING COLLABORATIVES, NATIONAL BREASTFEEDING CONFERENCE AND CONVENING, LEARNING AND ACTION COMMUNITIES, AND PEER NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES. IN ADDITION TO THESE EFFORTS, USBC?S STRATEGIC FOCUS SINCE 2012 HAS BEEN TO EMBED DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION (DEI) PRINCIPLES INTO THE STRUCTURE AND CULTURE OF THE ORGANIZATION. AS SUCH, USBC IS UNIQUELY POISED TO INCREASE ENGAGEMENT AND FURTHER BUILD THE CAPACITY OF TRIBAL, LOCAL, COMMUNITY, AND CULTURAL BREASTFEEDING COALITIONS ACROSS THE NATION.THROUGH THIS PROJECT, USBC WILL COORDINATE STAKEHOLDERS IN DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A 5-YEAR PLAN  FOR POLICY, SYSTEMS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES TO ADDRESS BREASTFEEDING INEQUITIES; INCREASE ACCESS TO BREASTFEEDING SUPPORT; AND ENHANCE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COLLABORATION AND CAPACITY BUILDING TARGETED AT STATE, TERRITORIAL, LOCAL, TRIBAL AND COMMUNITY (STLTC) BREASTFEEDING COALITIONS AND KEY MULTI-SECTORAL STAKEHOLDERS. USBC WILL ALSO IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES TO INCREASE LACTATION SUPPORT PROVIDERS? ADOPTION AND UTILIZATION OF CULTURALLY GROUNDED MATERNITY PRACTICES SUPPORTIVE OF BREASTFEEDING AND CDC GUIDANCE RELATED TO BREASTFEEDING CONTINUITY OF CARE. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON 2 SPECIFIC STRATEGIES: (1) PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND MANAGEMENT OF A COORDINATED AND SUSTAINED MULTI-SECTORAL PARTNERSHIP THAT ENGAGES EXISTING STATE BREASTFEEDING COALITIONS AND INCLUDES NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS SUPPORTING BREASTFEEDING AND (2) FACILITATE THE USE OF EVIDENCED BREASTFEEDING STRATEGIES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF STATES AND COMMUNITIES. IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE 2 STRATEGIES WILL LEAD TO THE SUCCESSFUL ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THE PROJECT?S LONG-TERM OUTCOME OF ?INCREASING AVAILABILITY AND ACCESS TO BREASTFEEDING RESOURCES, SUPPORT AND BREASTFEEDING-FRIENDLY ENVIRONMENTS, PARTICULARLY FOR AFRICAN AMERICAN AND NATIVE AMERICAN FAMILIES.?
